com.matejdro.bukkit.jail

Class JailPrisoner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.matejdro.bukkit.jail.JailPrisoner

  • public class JailPrisoner
extends java.lang.Object
    JailPrisoner class stores data about specific prisoner and allows you to modify status of the specified prisoner.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • JailPrisoner

        public JailPrisoner()

      • JailPrisoner

        public JailPrisoner(java.lang.String Name,
            int Remaintime,
            java.lang.String Jail,
            java.lang.String Cell,
            java.lang.Boolean Offline,
            java.lang.String TransferDest,
            java.lang.String Reason,
            java.lang.Boolean Muted,
            java.lang.String Inventory,
            java.lang.String Jailer,
            java.lang.String Permissions,
            org.bukkit.GameMode Gamemode)
        Parameters:
        Name - Name of this prisoner (player name)
        Remaintime - Jail time of this prisoner in tens of seconds (1 means 10 seconds)
        Jail - Name of the jail zone, where this prisoner will be jailed
        Cell - Name of the cell inside jail zone that prisoner will be jailed in. Can be empty or null if you don't want to specify cell.
        Offline - Is this prisoner scheduled for any actions such as jailing or transfering when he logs in.
        TransferDest - If this prisoner is waiting for transfer, this contains name of the destination jail zone
        Reason - Reason for jailing this prisoner
        Muted - Should this prisoner be muted (not allowed to chat) in jail?
        Inventory - Inventory string for this prisoner
        Jailer - Who jailed this prisoner

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Name of this prisoner (player name)

      • getRemainingTime

        public int getRemainingTime()
        Returns:
        Remaining jail time of this prisoner in tens of seconds (1 means 10 seconds)

      • setRemainingTime

        public void setRemainingTime(int input)
        Sets the remaining jail time of this prisoner
        Parameters:
        input - new remaining time in tens of seconds (1 means 10 seconds)

      • getRemainingTimeMinutes

        public double getRemainingTimeMinutes()
        Returns:
        remaining jail time of this prisoner in minutes

        Sets the remaining jail time of this prisoner
        Parameters:
        input - remaining jail time in minutes

      • getJail

        public JailZone getJail()
        Returns:
        jail zone, where this prisoner is jailed

      • setJail

        public void setJail(JailZone input)
        Change jail zone, where this prisoner is jailed. This only changes association, it will not do any teleportation, but prisoner may get teleported by protection, since he have new jail zone defined.
        Parameters:
        input - new jail zone

      • setJail

        public void setJail(java.lang.String jailname)
        Change jail zone, where this prisoner is jailed. This only changes association, it will not do any teleportation, but prisoner may get teleported by protection, since he have new jail zone defined.
        Parameters:
        jailname - name of the new jail zone

      • offlinePending

        public java.lang.Boolean offlinePending()
        Returns:
        True if this is prisoner scheduled for any actions such as jailing or transfering when he logs in. Otherwise, return false.

      • setOfflinePending

        public void setOfflinePending(java.lang.Boolean input)
        When this is enabled, events will trigger when prisoner logs in, thus making things such as offline (un)jailing or transfering possible.
        Parameters:
        input - should events be triggered on next log in?

      • getTransferDestination

        public java.lang.String getTransferDestination()
        Returns:
        Destination jail zone, if this prisoner is waiting for transfer.

      • setTransferDestination

        public void setTransferDestination(java.lang.String input)
        Change destination jail zone, when this prisoner is waiting for transfer.
        Parameters:
        input - transfer destination

      • isBeingReleased

        public java.lang.Boolean isBeingReleased()
        Returns:
        True, if this prisoner is under transfer or being released. Do not trigger any movement based protections when this is true.

      • SetBeingReleased

        public void SetBeingReleased(java.lang.Boolean input)
        This option turns off movement protections when active. Activate this, when you are teleporting prisoner around and don't want movement protections to kick in.
        Parameters:
        input - protection state

      • getReason

        public java.lang.String getReason()
        Returns:
        reason for jailing that prisoner

      • setReason

        public void setReason(java.lang.String input)
        Sets reason for jailing this prisoner
        Parameters:
        input - new reason

      • isMuted

        public java.lang.Boolean isMuted()
        Returns:
        Is this prisoner muted (cannot speak in jail)

      • setMuted

        public void setMuted(java.lang.Boolean input)
        This will mute prisoner, preventing him to speak inside jail. Use that to silence players that are spamming chat from jail.
        Parameters:
        input - new mute state. True = muted, False = can speak.

      • getCell

        public JailCell getCell()
        Returns:
        cell that belongs to this prisoner. Returns null if prisoner does not have its own cell.

      • setCell

        public void setCell(JailCell input)
        Sets cell that belongs to this prisoner.
        Parameters:
        input - new cell that will belong to this prisoner.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Sets list of permission groups that will be given to the player after he is released
        Parameters:
        permissions - List of com.platymuus.bukkit.permissions.Group

      • getTeleportLocation

        public org.bukkit.Location getTeleportLocation()
        Returns:
        Location, where player will be teleported after triggering move protection (teleport location of player's jail zone or his cell if he have one)

      • getReleaseTeleportLocation

        public org.bukkit.Location getReleaseTeleportLocation()
        Returns:
        Location, where player will be teleported after releasing (release location of player's jail zone or his before-jailing location if config is set so)

      • canGuardsBeSpawned

        public java.lang.Boolean canGuardsBeSpawned()
        Returns:
        Can you spawn guards to this prisoner? This will be false, if server is unable to spawn guards for example due to protection.

      • setGuardCanBeSpawned

        public void setGuardCanBeSpawned(java.lang.Boolean input)
        Parameters:
        input - Set this to false to skip guard spawning for this player and teleport him instead.

      • getPreviousPosition

        Sets position, where player was before he got jailed.
        Parameters:

      • spawnGuards

               org.bukkit.Location location,
               org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Spawn guard wolves to this prisoner to kill him
        Parameters:
        num - Number of guards to spawn
        location - Spawning location
        player - Player, associated with this JailPrisoner

        Parse , , , , , , for actual values
        Parameters:
        str - input string
        Returns:
        parsed string

      • release

        public void release()
        Initiate release procedure. If player is online, he will be released instantly, otherwise he will be released when he logs in.

      • transfer

        public void transfer()
        Transfer prisoner to next nearest jail. If player is online, he will be transfered instantly, otherwise he will be transfered when he logs in.

      • transfer

        public void transfer(java.lang.String targetjail)
        Transfer prisoner to specified jail. If player is online, he will be transfered instantly, otherwise he will be transfered when he logs in.
        Parameters:
        targetjail - Name of the destination jail zone

      • update

        public void update()
        Update data of this prisoner into database.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Delete prisoner from the database. No teleporting is involved.
